definition: snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean

thin piece/flake/a slice/film/TV play/to slice/to carve thin/partial/incomplete/one-sided/classifier for slices, tablets, tract of land, area of water/classifier for CDs, movies, DVDs etc/used with numeral 一[yi1]: classifier for scenario, scene, feeling, atmosphere, sound etc/Kangxi radical 91

sentences.english: He felt some of the snow slide in, penetrate his shirt.
sentences.chinese: 他感到有些雪片溜進大衣，透過襯衫。

sentences.english: The snowflakes were driven against the hut by a gale.
sentences.chinese: 大風把雪片刮到小屋旁邊堆積起來。

sentences.english: Sparsely flakes, scattered into the River South Garden.
The down is flying about like snow.
sentences.chinese: 這些毛像雪片似的亂飛。

sentences.english: Headquarters was swamped by an avalanche of applications for battle assignments.
sentences.chinese: 請戰書像雪片似地飛向指揮部。

sentences.english: Suddenly, falling up chunks of snow comes.
sentences.chinese: 陡然間，落起大塊的雪片來了。

sentences.english: It was flooded with letters from readers decrying the brutal nature of the trade.
sentences.chinese: 雪片般的讀者來信強烈反對這種野蠻的交易。
雪片裝點得樹木銀光燦燦。

sentences.english: The waning October afternoon is so hushed, he can hear snowflakes alight.
sentences.chinese: 十月的下午如此寂靜，他能聽到雪片飄落的聲音。

sentences.english: Every crystal was a masterpiece of design and no one design was ever repeated.
sentences.chinese: 每片水晶般的雪片都是大自然的傑作，絕不單調重複。

sentences.english: The letters snowed to the editorial department.
sentences.chinese: 來信雪片般地飛到了編輯部。

sentences.english: The snow was falling. Big flakes drifted with the wind like feathers.
sentences.chinese: 雪不停地下着，鵝毛似的雪片隨風飄舞。
抗議書像雪片似的飛來。

sentences.english: Letters of application descended on them like snowflakes .
sentences.chinese: 申請信件像雪片似地向他們飛來。

definition: (of snow etc) to fill the sky
lit. to fill the whole sky and cover the land; everywhere/as far as the eye can see
lit. to fill the whole sky/everywhere/as far as the eye can see
goose feather snow (idiom)/big heavy snow fall
to swirl in the air (of thickly falling snowflakes, flower petals etc)/to flutter about
lit. to fill the whole sky and cover the land; everywhere/as far as the eye can see
to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
very slight sound/rustling (onom.)/to stream down (of tears)/luxuriant growth (of vegetation)
